com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.filesystem
Class TraversePathIterator

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.filesystem.BaseTraversePathIter
      com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.filesystem.TraversePathIterator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterator<File>
@FullyTested
public abstract class TraversePathIterator
extends BaseTraversePathIter
implements Iterator<File>

Traverses a directory hierarchy similar to the UNIX command line tool find. Use the builder class TraversePathIterable to construct path iterators.

Terminology:

  • For "depth last" iterators, paths in each directory are iterated before descending any directories
  • For "depth first" iterators, paths in each directory are iterated after descending any directories

Example directory structure: 

topDir
   |
 file1 file2 dir1
              |
      file3 file4 dir2
                    |
                  file5

Directories are traversed in this order:

  • For "depth last" iterators: topDir, dir1, dir2
  • For "depth first" iterators: dir2, dir1, topDir

Possible path iterations:

  • For "depth last" iterators: topDir, file1, file2, dir1, file3, file4 dir2, file5
  • For "depth first" iterators: file5, file3, file4, dir2, file1, file2, dir1, topDir

Author:
Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)
See Also:
BaseTraversePathIter

tryDescendDirPath

canIterateDirPath

protected final boolean canIterateDirPath()

tryAddLevel

protected final com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.filesystem.TraversePathLevel tryAddLevel(File dirPath)
                                                                                  throws PathRuntimeException
Descend a directory by creating a directory listing. If result is not null, the depth increases by one.

Parameters:
dirPath - directory path to descend
Returns:
new deepest level or null if directory listing throws exception and exception policy dictates to ignore it
Throws:
PathRuntimeException - if directory listing throws exception and exception policy dictates to rethrow as a runtime (unchecked) exception
See Also:
tryRemoveAndGetNextLevel(), getDepth()

tryRemoveAndGetNextLevel

protected final com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.filesystem.TraversePathLevel tryRemoveAndGetNextLevel()
Remove the deepest level and return the next deepest level. If result is not null, the depth decreases by one.

Returns:
new deepest level or null if no remaining levels after removal
See Also:
tryAddLevel(File), getDepth()

hasNext

public abstract boolean hasNext()
                         throws PathRuntimeException
Tests if a next path exists for iteration. The first call to this method is comparatively more expensive than future calls.

Specified by:
hasNext in interface Iterator<File>
Throws:
PathRuntimeException - if an exception is thrown during a directory listing, and if exception policy dictates to throw the exception (TraversePathExceptionPolicy.THROW).
See Also:
next(), BaseTraversePathIter.getExceptionPolicy()

next

public abstract File next()
                   throws PathRuntimeException
Returns the next path in the iteration.

Specified by:
next in interface Iterator<File>
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if the iteration is complete. This is only thrown if hasNext() returns false.
PathRuntimeException - if an exception is thrown during a directory listing, and if exception policy dictates to throw the exception (TraversePathExceptionPolicy.THROW).
See Also:
hasNext(), BaseTraversePathIter.getExceptionPolicy()

remove

public final void remove()
Always throws UnsupportedOperationException.

Specified by:
remove in interface Iterator<File>

getDepth

public final int getDepth()
Returns:
number of levels below BaseTraversePathIter.getRootDirPath(). Minimum value is zero.
